column2: Slowly and painfully, through waves of deadly nausea and with the surging of deep waters in her ears, Diana struggled back to consciousness.
column3: Slowly and painfully, through waves of deadly nausea and with the surging of deep waters in her ears, Diana struggled back to consciousness.

column2: The agony in her head was excruciating, and her limbs felt cramped and bruised.
column3: The agony in her head was excruciating, and her limbs felt cramped and bruised.

column2: Recollection was dulled in bodily pain, and, at first, thought was merged in physical suffering.
column3: Recollection was dulled in bodily pain, and, at first, thought was merged in physical suffering.

column2: She remembered fragmentary incidents of what had gone before the oblivion from which she had just emerged.
column3: She remembered fragmentary incidents of what had gone before the oblivion from which she had just emerged.

column2: Her own dread--not of the death that was imminent, but lest the mercy it offered should be snatched from her.
column3: Her own dread-not of the death that was imminent, but lest the mercy it offered should be snatched from her.

column2: Then before the valet could effect his supreme devotion had come the hail of bullets, and he had fallen against her, the blood that poured from his wounds saturating her linen coat, and rolled over across her feet.
column3: Then before the valet could effect his supreme devotion had come the hail of bullets, and he had fallen against her, the blood that poured from his wounds saturating her linen coat, and rolled over across her feet.

column2: Her eyes were still shut; a leaden weight seemed fixed on them, and the effort to open them was beyond her strength.
column3: Her eyes were still shut; a leaden weight seemed fixed on them, and the effort to open them was beyond her strength.

column2: But instead of his body or the dry hot sand her fingers had expected to encounter they closed over soft cushions, and with the shock she sat up with a jerk, her eyes staring wide, but, sick and faint, she fell back again, her arm flung across her face, shielding the light that pierced like daggers through her throbbing eye-balls.
column3: But instead of his body or the dry hot sand her fingers had expected to encounter they closed over soft cushions, and with the shock she sat up with a jerk, her eyes staring wide, but, sick and faint, she fell back again, her arm flung across her face, shielding the light that pierced like daggers through her throbbing eye balls.

column2: For a while she lay still, fighting against the weakness that overpowered her, and by degrees the horrible nausea passed and the agony in her head abated, leaving only a dull ache.
column3: For a while she lay still, fighting against the weakness that overpowered her, and by degrees the horrible nausea passed and the agony in her head abated, leaving only a dull ache.

column2: She moved her arm slightly from before her eyes so that she could see, and looked cautiously from under thick lashes, screened by the sleeve of her coat.
column3: She moved her arm slightly from before her eyes so that she could see, and looked cautiously from under thick lashes, screened by the sleeve of her coat.

column2: She was lying on a pile of cushions in one corner of a small-tented apartment which was otherwise bare, except for the rug that covered the floor.
column3: She was lying on a pile of cushions in one corner of a small tented apartment which was otherwise bare, except for the rug that covered the floor.

column2: In the opposite corner of the tent an Arab woman crouched over a little brazier, and the smell of native coffee was heavy in the air.
column3: In the opposite corner of the tent an Arab woman crouched over a little brazier, and the smell of native coffee was heavy in the air.

column2: She closed her eyes again with a shudder. The attempted devotion of Gaston had been useless.
column3: She closed her eyes again with a shudder. The attempted devotion of Gaston had been useless.

column2: She lay still, pressing closely down amongst the cushions, and clenching the sleeve of her jacket between her teeth to stifle the groan that rose to her lips.
column3: She lay still, pressing closely down amongst the cushions, and clenching the sleeve of her jacket between her teeth to stifle the groan that rose to her lips.

column2: A lump came into her throat as she thought of Gaston.
column3: A lump came into her throat as she thought of Gaston.

column2: In those last moments all inequality of rank had been swept away in their common peril--they had been only a white man and a white woman together in their extremity.
column3: In those last moments all inequality of rank had been swept away in their common peril-they had been only a white man and a white woman together in their extremity.

column2: All that he could do he had done, he had shielded her body with his own, it must have been over his lifeless body that they had taken her.
column3: All that he could do he had done, he had shielded her body with his own, it must have been over his lifeless body that they had taken her.

column2: He had proved his faithfulness, sacrificing his life for his master's play-thing.
column3: He had proved his faithfulness, sacrificing his life for his master's play thing.

column2: Gaston was in all probability dead, but she was alive, and she must husband her strength for her own needs. She forced the threatening emotion down, and, with an effort, controlled the violent shivering in her limbs, and sat up slowly, looking at the Arab woman, who, hearing her move, turned to gaze at her.
column3: Gaston was in all probability dead, but she was alive, and she must husband her strength for her own needs. She forced the threatening emotion down, and, with an effort, controlled the violent shivering in her limbs, and sat up slowly, looking at the Arab woman, who, hearing her move, turned to gaze at her.

column2: Instantly Diana realised that there was no help or compassion to be expected from her.
column3: Instantly Diana realised that there was no help or compassion to be expected from her.

column2: And the feeling gave a necessary spur to the courage that was fast coming back to her.
column3: And the feeling gave a necessary spur to the courage that was fast coming back to her.

column2: Diana's muscles relaxed and she sat back easily on the cushions, the little passage of wills had restored her confidence in herself.
column3: Diana's muscles relaxed and she sat back easily on the cushions, the little passage of wills had restored her confidence in herself.

column2: She moved her hand and it brushed against her jacket, coming away stained and sticky, and she noticed for the first time that all one side and sleeve were soaked with blood.
column3: She moved her hand and it brushed against her jacket, coming away stained and sticky, and she noticed for the first time that all one side and sleeve were soaked with blood.

column2: She ripped it off with a shudder and flung it from her, rubbing the red smear from her hands with a kind of horror.
column3: She ripped it off with a shudder and flung it from her, rubbing the red smear from her hands with a kind of horror.

column2: Her sensitive lip curled with disgust, all her innate fastidiousness in revolt.
column3: Her sensitive lip curled with disgust, all her innate fastidiousness in revolt.

column2: The heat aggravated a burning thirst that was parching her throat.
column3: The heat aggravated a burning thirst that was parching her throat.

column2: She crossed the tent to the side of the Arab woman.
column3: She crossed the tent to the side of the Arab woman.

column2: Diana repeated the request in Arabic, one of the few sentences she knew without stumbling.
column3: Diana repeated the request in Arabic, one of the few sentences she knew without stumbling.

column2: Diana hated the sweet, thick stuff, but it would do until she could get the water she wanted, and she put out her hand to take the little cup. But her eyes met the other's fixed on her, and something in their malignant stare made her pause.
column3: Diana hated the sweet, thick stuff, but it would do until she could get the water she wanted, and she put out her hand to take the little cup. But her eyes met the other's fixed on her, and something in their malignant stare made her pause.

column2: What beyond the woman's expression made her think so she did not know, but she was sure of it.
column3: What beyond the woman's expression made her think so she did not know, but she was sure of it.

column2: She put the cup aside impatiently.
column3: She put the cup aside impatiently.

column2: No.	no
Not coffee.
column3: Not coffee.

column2: Before she realised what was happening the woman thrust a strong arm round her and forced the cup to her lips.
column3: Before she realised what was happening the woman thrust a strong arm round her and forced the cup to her lips.

column2: That confirmed Diana's suspicions and rage lent her additional strength.
column3: That confirmed Diana's suspicions and rage lent her additional strength.

column2: The woman was strong, but Diana was stronger, younger and more active.
column3: The woman was strong, but Diana was stronger, younger and more active.

column2: She dashed the cup to the floor, spilling its contents, and, with an effort, tore the clinging hands from her and sent the woman crashing on to the ground, rolling against the brazier, oversetting it, and scattering brass pots and cups over the rug.
column3: She dashed the cup to the floor, spilling its contents, and, with an effort, tore the clinging hands from her and sent the woman crashing on to the ground, rolling against the brazier, oversetting it, and scattering brass pots and cups over the rug.

column2: And, in answer to her cries, a curtain at the side of the tent, that Diana had not noticed, slid aside and a gigantic Nubian came in. With outstretched hand shaking with rage, pointing at Diana, she burst into voluble abuse, punctuating every few words with the shrieks that had brought the negro.
column3: And, in answer to her cries, a curtain at the side of the tent, that Diana had not noticed, slid aside and a gigantic Nubian came in. With outstretched hand shaking with rage, pointing at Diana, she burst into voluble abuse, punctuating every few words with the shrieks that had brought the negro.

column2: The Nubian listened with white teeth flashing in a broad grin, and shook his head in response to some request urged with denunciatory fist.
column3: The Nubian listened with white teeth flashing in a broad grin, and shook his head in response to some request urged with denunciatory fist.

column2: He picked up the last remaining embers that had scattered on the rug, rubbing the smouldering patches till they were extinguished, and then turned to leave the room.
column3: He picked up the last remaining embers that had scattered on the rug, rubbing the smouldering patches till they were extinguished, and then turned to leave the room.

column2: But Diana called him back.
column3: But Diana called him back.

column2: She went a step forward, her head high, and looked him straight in the face.
column3: She went a step forward, her head high, and looked him straight in the face.

column2: He pointed to the coffee that the woman had recommenced to make, her back turned to them, but Diana stamped her foot.
column3: He pointed to the coffee that the woman had recommenced to make, her back turned to them, but Diana stamped her foot.

column2: Water!	Water!
Bring me water!" she said again, more imperiously than before.
column3: Bring me water!" she said again, more imperiously than before.

column2: The thought of its condition made her hesitate for a moment, but only for a moment.
column3: The thought of its condition made her hesitate for a moment, but only for a moment.

column2: She picked up one of the clean coffee-cups that had rolled to her feet, rinsed it several times, and then drank.
column3: She picked up one of the clean coffee cups that had rolled to her feet, rinsed it several times, and then drank.

column2: The water was warm and slightly brackish, but she needed it too much to mind.
column3: The water was warm and slightly brackish, but she needed it too much to mind.

column2: In spite of being tepid it relieved the dry, suffocating feeling in her throat and refreshed her.
column3: In spite of being tepid it relieved the dry, suffocating feeling in her throat and refreshed her.

column2: But her courage had risen with a bound; the fact that she was physically stronger than the woman who had been put to guard her, and also that she had gained her point with the burly negro, had a great moral effect on her, further restoring her confidence in herself.
column3: But her courage had risen with a bound; the fact that she was physically stronger than the woman who had been put to guard her, and also that she had gained her point with the burly negro, had a great moral effect on her, further restoring her confidence in herself.

column2: Her position was an appalling one, but hope was strong within her.
column3: Her position was an appalling one, but hope was strong within her.

column2: She did not credit him with so much acumen.
column3: She did not credit him with so much acumen.

column2: If it could only be prolonged until Ahmed reached her.
column3: If it could only be prolonged until Ahmed reached her.

column2: If he only came in time! Hours had passed since the ambuscade had surprised them.
column3: If he only came in time! Hours had passed since the ambuscade had surprised them.

column2: It had been early afternoon then.
column3: It had been early afternoon then.

column2: Now the lighted lamp told her it was night.
column3: Now the lighted lamp told her it was night.

column2: How late she did not know.
column3: How late she did not know.

column2: Her watch had been broken some months before, and she had no means of even guessing the hour, but it must be well on in the evening.
column3: Her watch had been broken some months before, and she had no means of even guessing the hour, but it must be well on in the evening.

column2: By now the absence of herself and Gaston and their escort would be discovered.
column3: By now the absence of herself and Gaston and their escort would be discovered.

column2: He would know her peril and he would come to her.
column3: He would know her peril and he would come to her.

column2: Of that she had no doubt.
column3: Of that she had no doubt.

column2: Although he had changed so strangely in the last few days, though the wonderful gentleness of the last two months had merged again into indifference and cruelty, still she never doubted.
column3: Although he had changed so strangely in the last few days, though the wonderful gentleness of the last two months had merged again into indifference and cruelty, still she never doubted.

column2: He might discard her at his own pleasure, but no one would take her from him with impunity.
column3: He might discard her at his own pleasure, but no one would take her from him with impunity.

column2: Her woman's intuition had sensed the jealousy that had actuated him during the unhappy days since Saint Hubert had come.
column3: Her woman's intuition had sensed the jealousy that had actuated him during the unhappy days since Saint Hubert had come.

column2: An inconsistent jealousy that had been unprovoked and unjustified, but for which she had suffered. She had known last night, when she winced under his sarcastic tongue, and later, when Saint Hubert had left them and his temper had suddenly boiled over, that she was paying for the unaccustomed strain that he was putting on his own feelings.
column3: An inconsistent jealousy that had been unprovoked and unjustified, but for which she had suffered. She had known last night, when she winced under his sarcastic tongue, and later, when Saint Hubert had left them and his temper had suddenly boiled over, that she was paying for the unaccustomed strain that he was putting on his own feelings.

column2: His curses had eaten into her heart, and she had fled from him to stifle the coward instinct that urged her to confess her love and beg his mercy.
column3: His curses had eaten into her heart, and she had fled from him to stifle the coward instinct that urged her to confess her love and beg his mercy.

column2: And long after she knew from his even breathing that he was asleep she had lain wide-eyed beside him, grasping at what happiness she could, living for the moment as she had schooled herself to live, trying to be content with just the fact of his nearness.
column3: And long after she knew from his even breathing that he was asleep she had lain wide eyed beside him, grasping at what happiness she could, living for the moment as she had schooled herself to live, trying to be content with just the fact of his nearness.

column2: And the indifference of the night had been maintained when he had left her at dawn, his persistent silence pointing the continuance of his displeasure.
column3: And the indifference of the night had been maintained when he had left her at dawn, his persistent silence pointing the continuance of his displeasure.

column2: He would come!
column3: He would come!

column2: He would come!
column3: He would come!

column2: He would not let anything happen to her.
column3: He would not let anything happen to her.

column2: The reversal of the role he played in her life brought a quivering smile to her lips.
column3: The reversal of the role he played in her life brought a quivering smile to her lips.

column2: For the advent of the man who a few weeks before she had loathed for his brutal abduction of herself she now prayed with the desperation of despair.
column3: For the advent of the man who a few weeks before she had loathed for his brutal abduction of herself she now prayed with the desperation of despair.

column2: He represented safety, salvation, everything that made life worth living.
column3: He represented safety, salvation, everything that made life worth living.

column2: But the sharp, guttural voice predominating over the other voices killed the wild hope that had sprung up in her by its utter dissimilarity to the soft low tones for which she longed.
column3: But the sharp, guttural voice predominating over the other voices killed the wild hope that had sprung up in her by its utter dissimilarity to the soft low tones for which she longed.

column2: Ibraheim Omair!
column3: Ibraheim Omair!

column2: He had come first!
column3: He had come first!

column2: She stood rigid, one foot beating nervously into the soft rug.
column3: She stood rigid, one foot beating nervously into the soft rug.

column2: The voices in the next room continued, until Diana almost prayed for the moment she was waiting for would come; suspense was worse than the ordeal for which she was nerving herself, It came at last.
column3: The voices in the next room continued, until Diana almost prayed for the moment she was waiting for would come; suspense was worse than the ordeal for which she was nerving herself, It came at last.

column2: The curtain slid aside again, and the same huge negro she had seen before entered. He came towards her, and her breath hissed in suddenly between her set teeth, but before he reached her the Arab woman intercepted him, blocking his way, and with wild eyes and passionate gestures poured out a stream of low, frenzied words.
column3: The curtain slid aside again, and the same huge negro she had seen before entered. He came towards her, and her breath hissed in suddenly between her set teeth, but before he reached her the Arab woman intercepted him, blocking his way, and with wild eyes and passionate gestures poured out a stream of low, frenzied words.

column2: The Nubian turned on her impatiently and thrust her roughly out of his way, and, coming to Diana, put out his hand as if to grasp her arm, but she stepped back with flashing eyes and a gesture that he obeyed.
column3: The Nubian turned on her impatiently and thrust her roughly out of his way, and, coming to Diana, put out his hand as if to grasp her arm, but she stepped back with flashing eyes and a gesture that he obeyed.

column2: Her heart was pounding, but she had herself under control.
column3: Her heart was pounding, but she had herself under control.

column2: Only her hands twitched, her long fingers curling and uncurling spasmodically, and she buried them deep in her breeches' pockets to hide them.
column3: Only her hands twitched, her long fingers curling and uncurling spasmodically, and she buried them deep in her breeches' pockets to hide them.

column2: She walked slowly to the curtain and nodded to the Nubian to draw it aside, and slower still she passed into the other room.
column3: She walked slowly to the curtain and nodded to the Nubian to draw it aside, and slower still she passed into the other room.

column2: Only a little larger than the one she had left, almost as bare, but her mind took in these things uncomprehendingly, for all her attention was focussed on the central figure in the room.
column3: Only a little larger than the one she had left, almost as bare, but her mind took in these things uncomprehendingly, for all her attention was focussed on the central figure in the room.

column2: The hold she was exercising over herself was tremendous, her body was rigid with the effort, and her hands deep down in her pockets clenched till the nails bit into the palms.
column3: The hold she was exercising over herself was tremendous, her body was rigid with the effort, and her hands deep down in her pockets clenched till the nails bit into the palms.

column2: Every instinct was rebelling against the calm she forced upon herself.
column3: Every instinct was rebelling against the calm she forced upon herself.

column2: She longed to scream and make a dash for the opening that she guessed was behind her, and to take her chance in the darkness outside.
column3: She longed to scream and make a dash for the opening that she guessed was behind her, and to take her chance in the darkness outside.

column2: But she knew that such a chance was impossible; if she ever reached the open air she would never be allowed to get more than a few steps from the tent.
column3: But she knew that such a chance was impossible; if she ever reached the open air she would never be allowed to get more than a few steps from the tent.

column2: Her only course lay in the bravado that alone kept her from collapse.
column3: Her only course lay in the bravado that alone kept her from collapse.

column2: She must convey the impression of fearlessness, though cold terror was knocking at her heart.
column3: She must convey the impression of fearlessness, though cold terror was knocking at her heart.

column2: His heavy face lit up with a gleam of malicious satisfaction as Diana came towards him, his loose mouth broadened in a wicked smile.
column3: His heavy face lit up with a gleam of malicious satisfaction as Diana came towards him, his loose mouth broadened in a wicked smile.
